ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Sample description: tissue type, i.e. blood, saliva, brain etc.
ValueRange: whole blood; saliva; brain; urine; serum; plasma; CSF; IPS; Fibroblast; Neuronal Progenitor; skin biopsy; temporal cortex; lymphoblastoid cell line; unknown; semen; frontal cortex; parietal cortex; basal ganglia; Placenta; hair; occipital visual cortex; cerebellum; spleen; stool; muscle; kidney; liver; heart; cord blood; nasal swab; DNA; RNA

ElementDescription: dbGaP; NDAR; NIMH Genetics; AGRE; Sfari
Sample provider: i.e. NIMH_Genetics; ATP; Correil
Miscellaneous comments on study, interview, methodology relevant to this form data
Sequencing batch: Date sent to sequencing facility
The event name for which the data was collected

Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Antibody used against histone protein in order to immuno-precipitate the chromatin
Name of genotyping array chip used
Version of genotyping array chip used
RIN equivalent (RINe) value for assigning integrity values to RNA
Brain tissue used to isolate the DNA/RNA i.e.
ValueRange: ACC; DLPFC; CER; dACC; STG; Dura; Hippo
Notes: anterior cingulate cortex (ACC); dorsal anterior cingulate cortex (dACC); dorsolateral prefrontal cortex (DLPFC); cerebellum (CER); superior temporal gyrus (STG); Dura mater (Dura); Hippocampus (Hippo);

ElementDescription: Sample preparation batch OR DNA/RNA Isolation batch OR experimental batch
